title: Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE)
description: A hybrid quantum-classical algorithm designed to find the ground state energy of molecular and chemical systems. VQE combines the power of quantum computers with classical optimization techniques, making it particularly well-suited for near-term quantum devices.
complexity: Depends on ansatz and optimization strategy

keyComponents.name: Parameterized Quantum Circuit
keyComponents.description: Implements the variational ansatz state preparation

keyComponents.name: Hamiltonian Decomposition
keyComponents.description: Breaks down problem Hamiltonian into measurable terms

keyComponents.name: Classical Optimizer
keyComponents.description: Updates circuit parameters to minimize energy

workingPrinciple: VQE works by preparing a trial quantum state using a parameterized circuit, measuring the energy expectation value, and using classical optimization to adjust parameters and find the ground state.

applications.description: Finding ground state energies of molecules

limitations: Circuit depth limited by hardware noise
furtherReading: Original paper: 'The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms'
Review: 'Quantum Chemistry in the Age of Quantum Computing'
